Post.title: Hello There
Post._content:
It really took a lot of time for me to set this blog up using octopress.<!--more--> This can't be done without Google and Baidu with which i
searched out all solutions when encounted with problems. I would like  to give my special thanks to [this excellent post](http://caiqinghua.com/blog/2013/08/26/deploy-octopress-to-github-pages/) which coverd nearly all the things that need to be done.
Anyway, here i am. Hello world!

*Note*: this post is  old and may contains out-date information.

Post.title: R Package nmcdr is Now on CRAN
Post._content:
(change-point)<!--more-->  

  
   
R  bcp, cpm, ecp, changepoint [](http://sms.nankai.edu.cn/teacher/szdw/xs004/51.html)[](http://www.e-publications.org/ims/submission/AOS/user/submissionFile/17525?confirm=abd32a18)R [nmcdr](http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/nmcdr/index.html)( 0.3.0 ) CRAN   

nmcdr  nmcd  

```    
     nmcd(x, kmax, cpp, ncp, n)   
```

 x 

```  
    #       
    library(nmcdr)   
    data(Blocks)  
```

nmcdr  Blocks 11 100 130 150 230 250, 400 440 650 760 780 810.    
    
```
    t <- nmcd(Blocks)   
```

nmcd 11 102 132 158 231 251 401 441 651 761 781 811.     
 t,   

```    
    plot(t)    
```

{% img http://pic.yupoo.com/lancezhange_v/DMOspifF/SoeNk.png %}  

 BIC   

```    
    summary(t)  
```

 
2D nmcdr  R  EBImage   

```    
    library(EBImage)   
    # vignette("EBImage-introduction")  
    library(nmcdr)  
    library(foreach) #   
    library(doParallel)  
    
    cl <- makeCluster(4)   # 4  
    registerDoParallel(cl)    
    
    # 
    f = system.file("images", "lena.png", package="EBImage")  
    lena = readImage(f)  
    #  display(lena)   
```

  
{% img http://pic.yupoo.com/lancezhange_v/DMOsbku3/cQcrm.png %}      

```    
    mlena = imageData(lena)  
    dim(mlena)  
```

 512 X 512  0-1   

```
    #   
    rmlena = foreach(i = 1:nrow(mlena), .combine = rbind, .packages="nmcdr")   %dopar% {  
    t = nmcd(mlena[i,])$cpp  
    mlena[i,t]=1     #   
    mlena[i,-t]=0    #     
    mlena[i,]  
    }  
    #   
    writeImage(rmlena,"lenaEdgeDetectionRowChangePoint.png")  
```

  
{% img http://pic.yupoo.com/lancezhange_v/DMOspL8a/m1yem.png %}

Post.title: word2vec
Post._content:
[word2vec](http://code.google.com/p/word2vec/) google C windows  cygwin  make  pthread.h  pthread.h  linux [](http://blog.csdn.net/zhoubl668/article/details/24314769) word2vec  high, <!--more-->  

[spark](https://spark.apache.org/)  1.1.0  word2vec [](http://people.apache.org/~pwendell/spark-1.1.0-snapshot2-docs/mllib-feature-extraction.html)(`val line = Source.fromFile("e:/tempfile/text8").getLines`  `java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space`  `val n = sc.textFile("e:/tempfile/text8").count`  spark ) text8 90M+    

(**Emma**) [Project Gutenberg](http://www.gutenberg.org/)

```
    import org.apache.spark.mllib.feature.Word2Vec
    val input = sc.textFile("e:/database/emma/emma.txt").map(line => line.split(" ").toSeq)  
    val word2vec = new Word2Vec()
    val model = word2vec.fit(input)  
```

 Emma   

```
    val synonyms = model.findSynonyms("Emma", 40)
    for((synonym, cosineSimilarity) <- synonyms) {
        println(s"$synonym $cosineSimilarity")
     }
```

 

```
    synonyms.foreach{case (synonym, cosineSimilarity) => printf("%-20s %-20.16f\n",synonym, cosineSimilarity)}
```



{% img http://pic.yupoo.com/lancezhange_v/E7wetj2D/NRDtx.jpg %}  

[](http://datatang.com/)  8 spark  word2vec  R  **Rwordseg**  words.txt 
     
```
     library(Rwordseg)
     
     data_dir = "E:/database//"
     files = list.files(data_dir,pattern="*.txt")
     result_file = "e:/tempfile/words.txt"
     
     for(i in 1: length(files)){
       filename = paste(data_dir, files[i],sep="/")
       content = readLines(filename) # 
       term = unlist(lapply(content, segmentCN))
       write(term, file = result_file, append=T, ncolumns=10)
      }
```

 words.txt 40M spark  word2vec  
 powershell  spark-shell  Python ----  

 word2vec     
Python  [Gensim](http://radimrehurek.com/gensim/models/word2vec.html) word2vec   `pip install --upgrade gensim`   `import gensim`   ImportError: cannot import name utils  
Java  [DL4J](http://deeplearning4j.org/compare-dl4j-torch7-pylearn.html)(Deep learning for Java)  word2vec LAPACK windows   
 **tmcn.word2vec**  CRAN R-Forge 

    install.packages("tmcn.word2vec", repos="http://R-Forge.R-project.org",type="source")

  

[ windows  wrod2vec C](https://github.com/zhangyafeikimi/word2vec-win32) github  cygwin  make,  unknown character  warnings (who cares warnings?)  


    ./word2vec -train e:/tempfile/words.txt -output vectors.bin -cbow 0 -size 200 -window 5 -negative 0 -hs 1 -sample 1e-3 -threads 12 -binary 1  

(6K4W+  


    ./distance vectors.bin

Post.title: GSL  Ubuntu
Post._content:
[GSL(GNU Scientific Library)](http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/)<!--more-->GSL  

 windwos GNU  cygwin windows  ubuntu 12.04 GSL

 gsl-1.9

```
      ./configure
      make
      make install
```

 `make install` /usr/local/lib /usr/local/include  'sudo make install'

[](http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/manual/html_node/An-Example-Program.html#An-Example-Program)

```
     #include <stdio.h>
     #include <gsl/gsl_sf_bessel.h>
     int main (void)
     {
       double x = 5.0;
       double y = gsl_sf_bessel_J0 (x);
       printf ("J0(%g) = %.18e\n", x, y);
       return 0;
      }
```

( test.c)

```
     gcc -lgsl -lgslcblas test.c -o test
```

`undefined reference to gsl_sf_bessel_J0`

```
     gcc test.c -lgsl -lgslcblas   test.c -o test   
```



GSL [](http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/manual/html_node/), [GSL](http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/design/gsl-design_toc.html)

<!--more-->
$$
\begin{align}
& \int_0^a\int_0^a\cdots\int_0^a max(x_1, x_2, \cdots, x_n)^{1-n}\, dx_1\, dx_2\,\cdots dx_n \\\
& = n\times a \tag {1} \label {1}
\end{align}
$$


\eqref{1}$x_i(i=1,...n)$$(0,a)$\eqref{1}

$$
\begin{align}
\eta: = max(x_1, x_2, \cdots, x_n)^{1-n} \qquad \qquad \qquad  \\\
 x_i(i=1,...n)(0,a)n  \\\
E(\eta) = \int_0^a\int_0^a\cdots\int_0^a\[max(x_1,x_2,\cdots,x_n)^{1-n}\](\frac 1 a)^n \, dx_1\, dx_2\,\cdots dx_n \\\
\Rightarrow \eqref{1} = a^n \times E(\eta) \quad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad
\end{align}
$$

$E(\eta)$$\eta$Gf

$$
\begin{align}
G(x)  = p(\eta \lt x) \\\
= p(x(n)^{1-n} \lt x) \\\
= p(x(n) \lt x^{\frac 1 {1-n}}) \\\
\Rightarrow f(x) = \frac n {a^n \times (1-n)} \times x^{\frac {2n-1} {1-n}}
\end{align}
$$

$E(\eta) = \frac n {a^{n-1}}$$I = a^n * E(\eta) = n\times a$

 n =3, a =2, R

```r
    p = function(a=2,k=100000){
        n=3
        a1 = runif(k,0,a)
        a2 = runif(k,0,a)
        a3 = runif(k,0,a)
        ma = pmax(pmax(a1,a2), a3)
        eta = 1/(ma**2)
        meta = mean(eta) # eta 
        meta*(a**n)      # 
    }
```

6



$$
max(x_1, x_2,\cdots, x_n)=x_n
$$

$x_n$ $(0,x_n)$

$$
\begin{align}
\int_0^a\int_0^{x_n}\cdots\int_0^{x_n} {x_n}^{1-n}\, dx_1\, dx_2\,\cdots dx_n \tag{2} \label{2}
\end{align}
$$

\eqref{2}aa.   
\eqref{2}(0,a)$x_n$$\gt \frac a 2$ 0.5n$\gt \frac a 2$$1- (\frac 1 2)^n$n0.51""

$$

$x_n$ $(0,x_n)$

$$
\begin{align}
\int_0^a\int_0^{x_n}\cdots\int_0^{x_n} {x_n}^{1-n}\, dx_1\, dx_2\,\cdots dx_n \tag{2} \label{2}
\end{align}
$$

\eqref{2}aa.
\eqref{2}(0,a)$x_n$$\gt \frac a 2$ 0.5n$\gt \frac a 2$$1- (\frac 1 2)^n$n0.51

[](http://baike.baidu.com/item/%E8%8E%B1%E6%98%82%E5%93%88%E5%BE%B7%C2%B7%E6%AC%A7%E6%8B%89?from_id=162567&type=syn&fromtitle=%E6%AC%A7%E6%8B%89&fr=aladdin)<!--more-->



$$
\sum\_{n=1}{\frac 1 {n^2}} = \frac {\pi^2} 6 \tag {1} \label {1} \\\
$$

\eqref{1}$\pi$

1734$\eqref{1}$$sin$$f(x)$12$f(x)$$a(1-\frac x 1)(1-\frac x 2)$a$sin(\pi x)$$sin$$sin(\pi x)$

$$
sin \pi x = \pi x - \frac {(\pi x)^3} {3!} + \frac {(\pi x)^5} {5!} - \cdots  \tag{2} \label{2}
$$
$sin \pi x$

$$
sin \pi x  = ax(1-x)(1+x)(1-\frac x 2)(1+\frac x 2)\cdots \\\
 = ax\prod\_{n=1}^\infty (1-\frac x n)(1+\frac x n) \\\
 = ax\prod\_{n=1}^\infty (1- \frac {x^2} {n^2}) \tag{3} \label{3}
$$

\eqref{2}\eqref{3}$x$$a = \pi$$x^3$

$$
\pi \sum\_{n=1}^\infty \frac 1 {n^2} = -\frac {\pi ^3} 6 \\\
\to \sum\_{n=1}^\infty \frac 1 {n^2} = \frac {\pi ^2} 6
$$



\eqref{1}$\sum_{n=1}\frac 1 n$ 

$$
\sum\_{p\in P} \frac 1 p = \frac 1 2 + \frac 1 3 + \frac 1 5 + \cdots \tag{4} \label{4}
(P)
$$

1737\eqref{4}



$$
\sum\_{n=1} \frac 1 n = \prod\_{p\in P}(1 + \frac 1 p + \frac 1 {p^2} + \frac 1 {p^3} + \cdots)  \tag {5} \label{5} \\\
= \prod\_{p\in P} \frac 1 {1-\frac 1 p} 
$$

\eqref{5}******1\eqref{5}$(a+b)(c+d) = ac + ad + bc + bd$\eqref{5}

$$
(1 + \frac 1 2 + \frac 1 {2^2} + \frac 1 {2^3} + \cdots)(1 + \frac 1 3 + \frac 1 {3^2} + \frac 1 {3^3} + \cdots)(\cdots)(\cdots)\cdots 
$$

11$\frac 1 2$1$\frac 1 2$, $\frac 1 n$ \eqref{5}

\eqref{5} 

$$
\begin{align}
1 + \frac 1 p + \frac 1 {p^2} + \cdots = e^{\frac 1 p + O(\frac 1 {p^2})}
\end{align}
$$

 

$$
\sum\_\{p\in P\} \frac 1 \{p^2\} \le \sum_\{n=1\} \frac 1 \{n^2\}
$$

$\sum_{p\in P} \frac 1 p$

Post.title: Hello Hexo and Goodbay Octopress
Post._content:
So, Hello Hexo, and Goodbay Octopress
<!--more-->
## why move from octopress to hexo
Speed is the main concern. Octopress can be very slow , while hexo is lightening fast.
Second reason is  that i like this pretty theme [Yilia](https://github.com/litten/hexo-theme-yilia). Many thanks to its  author litten. 

## What changed
#### mathjax 
Some math formulas in my old octopress posts could not be rendered properly. So i changed contents of the file `/themes/yilia/layout/_partial/mathjax.ejs` to following:

```
<!-- mathjax config similar to math.stackexchange -->
<script type="text/x-mathjax-config">
MathJax.Hub.Config({
   jax: ["input/TeX", "output/HTML-CSS"],
   tex2jax: {
   inlineMath: [ ['$', '$'] ],
   displayMath: [ ['$$', '$$']],
   processEscapes: true,
   skipTags: ['script', 'noscript', 'style', 'textarea', 'pre', 'code']
  },
  messageStyle: "none"
});
</script>
<script src="http://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS_HTML" type="text/javascript"></script>
```

Characters like `_` and `*` must be manually escaped to get mathjax working properly.

#### D3, Impress.js, P5.js
Those amazing posts i wrote in octopress which used d3/impress/p5 could not work anymore. Currently i do not have much time to make them work in hexo(you known, final exams are coming!), but i will do this in future.

```
npm install hexo-render-pug --save
```

2. Yilia  stylus CSSCSS maopassant CSSstyle.scss

3.  
yml`mathjax: true`jade
```
script(type='text/x-mathjax-config').
  MathJax.Hub.Config({
    tex2jax: {inlineMath: [['$','$'], ['\\(','\\)']]}
    });

script(type='text/javascript', src='https://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-MML-AM_CHTML', async)
```
  
```
script(type='text/x-mathjax-config').
  MathJax.Hub.Config({
  jax: ["input/TeX", "output/HTML-CSS"],
  tex2jax: {
    inlineMath: [ ['$', '$'] ],
    displayMath: [ ['$$', '$$']],
    processEscapes: true,
    skipTags: ['script', 'noscript', 'style', 'textarea', 'pre', 'code']
  },
  messageStyle: "none"
  });
script(type='text/javascript', src='http://cdn.mathjax.org/mathjax/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS_HTML', async)
```
